main event: On 5 September 1949, an unconventional aircraft was sighted by military personnel flying at approximately 7,000 feet above sea level in the vicinity of Lebec, California.
interesting points: The object was described as oval in shape and metallic, approximately 36 feet in diameter., It rapidly gained altitude, turned in a sharp left bank, and headed south without any sign of exhaust or sound., The aerial sighting lasted about 2 minutes before the object disappeared., There were no other confirmed witnesses to the event recorded in the investigation., Local weather conditions at the time were clear with visibility of 50 miles, and no conventional aircraft were confirmed in the area during the sighting.
sighted object: An unconventional aircraft, described as oval and metallic.
witness description: Military personnel from the 3538th Maintenance Squadron, Mather AFB, California, who were considered truthful and reliable.
